alert.note: Alert for Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 2:56PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
